definitions.title: n.pr.m.coll.
definitions.body: (construed as pl. De 3:9 + 5 t.) Amorites (perh. = mountain-dwellers, cf. Nu 13:29, De 1:7, De 1:19 f. etc. & Di Ge 10:16 al.)—alw.c. art., exc. Nu 21:29, Ez Eze 16:45.

a chief people dispossessed by Hebrews; (a) living E. of Jordan Nu 21:13, Nu 21:13, Nu 21:25 + 9 t. Nu + Jos 24:8 (all E), cf. Jos 2:10, Jos 9:10 (JE) De 1:4, De 3:2, De 3:9 + 7 t. D; also Ju Jdg 10:8, Jdg 10:11, Jdg 11:19, Jdg 11:21, Jdg 11:23, Jdg 11:23, 1Ki 4:19, Ps 135:11, Ps 136:19 (Sihon their king Nu 21:1 +; Sihon & Og De 3:8 + ); (b) living W. of Jordan Jos 10:5, Jos 10:6, Jos 24:12, Jos 24:15, Jos 24:18 (all E), cf. Jos 7:7 (JE); Jos 5:1, Jos 10:12, (both D; cf. also Jos 13:4, q. del. Di) Ju Jdg 1:34, Jdg 1:35, Jdg 1:36, Jdg 6:10, 1Ki 21:26, 2Ki 21:11 cf. 1Sa 21:2; (c) living in south De 1:7, De 1:19, De 1:20, De 1:27, De 1:44; cf. Ge 14:7 (W. of Dead Sea); (d) in gen. = ancient inhabitants of Canaan Ge 15:16 (J or R) Ge 48:22 (E) Am 2:9, Am 2:10; (e) named in list of Canaanitish peoples, to be dispossessed by Isr. Ex 3:8, Ex 3:17, Ex 13:5, Ex 33:2, Ex 34:11, Jos 3:10, Jos 9:1 (all J); De 7:1, De 20:17, Jos 11:3, Jos 12:8 (all D); Ex 23:23, Nu 13:29, Jos 24:11 (all E); Ju Jdg 3:5, 1Ki 9:20, 2Ch 8:7, Ezr 9:1, Ne 9:8; cf. Ez Eze 16:3, Eze 16:45; (on these lists cf. Bu:Urgesch 344 ff. & We:JBTh xxi. 602.)
